ai-ud4.2:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying in the sal forest of the Mallas at Upavattana near Kusinārā.
ai-ud4.2:1.3_0: Now at that time several mendicants were staying not far from the Buddha in a wilderness hut. They were restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying minds and undisciplined faculties.
ai-ud4.2:2.1_0: The Buddha saw those mendicants staying nearby.
ai-ud4.2:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud4.2:5.1_0: That’s why you should guard the mind,
ai-ud4.2:5.3_0: and right view at the fore.
ai-ud4.2:5.5_0: a mendicant who has overcome dullness and drowsiness
